text:
“Why, you Rodion Romanovitch! You are the murderer,” Porfiry whispered. 

Raskolnikov jumped up, then sat down again, speechless. His face twitched. 

“Your lip is twitching just as it did before,” Porfiry noted. 

“I came to deal openly with you,” he added. 

“It was not I who murdered her,” Raskolnikov murmured, trembling. 

“No, it was you, and no one else,” Porfiry replied firmly. 

Silence stretched between them for ten long minutes. 

Raskolnikov ran his fingers through his hair. 

“You are at your old tricks again, Porfiry Petrovitch!” he sneered. 

“Stop that. It doesn’t matter now,” Porfiry said calmly. 

“I’m convinced without your confession.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Porfiry Petrovtich confronts Raskolnikov with the conviction that he is the murderer, leading to a tense and silent exchange between them.
